code.displayName: propensity to adverse reactions to drug

item.content: Medications listed here may not be up to date.
Always verify current medications with the patient.

tr.td: Take 1 tablet by mouth 2 times daily as needed.

paragraph.content: GERD, diagnosed by EGD. Symptoms well controlled with inermittent prn use
of H2 blockers.
Diagnosed 4/14/2000 by elevation of TSH after presentation for general
exam with persistent fatigue as primary symptom. Synthoid started at that
time. Family history negative for thyroid disease.

tr.td: Unspecified Hypothyroidism (Primary Dx); Gerd (Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease)

paragraph.content: Date of Admission: 9/2/10
Date of Discharge: 9/5/10
Admission diagnosis: left lower lobe pneumonia
Discharge diagnoses: left lower lobe pneumonia, hypothyroidism,
hypertension
Attending: Cooper, Lynn
Hospital Course: The patient was admitted following his presentation to
the emergency department and initial diagnosis of pneumonia. His initial
presentation was shortness of breath, cough, and mild hypoxia. His exam
was notable for ronchi in the left lung field and a temp of 102.1. He was
started on ceftriaxone and erythromycin. Sputum cultures were
obtained but no definitive growth was obtained. His continued on
antibiotics for total of seven days with prompt improvement in symptoms.
He had no further fever after day two of his admission and his pulse
oximetry improved after day two such that he no longer required any
supplemental oxygen.
His initial x-ray indicated in left lower lobe pneumonia. Repeat cxr day
of discharge showed similar patterns but improvement. I expect that he
will show some radiographic changes for several weeks following discharge
despite the significant improvement in his condition. His laboratory
abnormalities have improved uneventfully.
Discharge Medications:
Synthroid 0.1 mg q day
Pepcid 20 mg prn
Follow Up: Dr. Carnegie in one week
Activity: ad lib
Diet: ad lib
He should call his doctor if he has fever > 101, increased shortness of
breath, worsened cough, or chest pain.

playingEntity.name: WI Harbor Bluff North Family Practice
WI Harbor Prairie East Internal Medicine

item.caption: ASSAY THYROID STIM HORMONE (Thu Sep 2, 2010 4:57 PM)

td.paragraph: Dense infiltrate in LLL consistent with infectious process. Lungs
